alert.note: Alert for Fresno; Madera (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 14 at 11:14PM PST until January 15 at 12:15AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Fresno County in central California... Central Madera County in central California... * Until 1215 AM PST. * At 1114 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hurley and Auberry. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away.
